title: Define Project Scope and Requirements
description: Gather and document the requirements for the BrainOrganiodSimulator project, including the desired features, functionalities, and constraints.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall architecture of the BrainOrganiodSimulator system, including the computational models, data structures, algorithms, and frameworks required for simulating brain organoid development and behavior. Consider the following aspects: 1) Modeling techniques for simulating biological processes (e.g., agent-based models, partial differential equations, cellular automata), 2) Data management and storage for simulation inputs and outputs (e.g., relational databases, NoSQL databases, file-based storage), 3) Parallel computing and distributed processing for handling computationally intensive simulations (e.g., GPU acceleration, cloud computing, high-performance computing clusters), 4) Visualization and analysis tools for interpreting simulation results (e.g., 3D rendering, interactive data exploration, machine learning-based analysis), 5) Integration with existing neuroscience tools and databases (e.g., Allen Brain Atlas, NeuroMorpho, BIDS), 6) Scalability and performance optimizations (e.g., caching, load balancing, asynchronous processing), 7) Error handling and fault tolerance mechanisms (e.g., checkpointing, redundancy, monitoring and alerting).

title: Develop Computational Models
description: Implement the computational models for simulating brain organoid development and behavior based on the approved system architecture.

title: Build User Interface
description: Design and develop the user interface for the BrainOrganiodSimulator, allowing researchers to input parameters, visualize simulations, and analyze results.

title: Implement Data Management
description: Design and implement the data management system for storing, retrieving, and analyzing simulation data and results.

title: Develop Testing Framework
description: Create a comprehensive testing framework for validating the computational models, user interface, and data management components.

title: Implement Security Measures
description: Ensure the BrainOrganiodSimulator system is secure by implementing appropriate security measures, such as authentication, authorization, and data encryption.

title: Set up Deployment Infrastructure
description: Establish the deployment infrastructure for the BrainOrganiodSimulator system, including server configuration, continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines, and monitoring tools.

title: Create Documentation
description: Develop comprehensive documentation for the BrainOrganiodSimulator system, including user guides, technical documentation, and maintenance manuals.
